author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four youths surrendered before the warden, Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary (WWS), at Sulthan Bathery on Tuesday morning in connection with the attack on migrant elephants in the sanctuary.

Shamal Hashim (21) of Puthanpuarayil, M. Shameer (21) of Palapadiyan veedu, Abdul Razak (21) of Parapurathu house, and Riyas (26) of Cheeramkuzhiyil at Mukkilpeedika near Mepadi in the district surrendered before P. Dhaneshkumar, warden, WWS.

The accused hurled stones at a wild elephant and its calf while the elephants were crossing the Kozhikode-Mysore National Highway that passes through the sanctuary, in search of a waterhole, Mr. Dhaneshkumar told The Hindu .

The Hindu had published the activities of the miscreant tourists on Monday.

The accused were charged under Section 2(16) 9 (hunting) of the Wildlife protection Act 1972.
title: Four surrender after attack on elephants
